snippet: A few years ago, rising gasoline prices pretty much destroyed the market for the big trucks, but they have become popular again.
abstract: Big sports utility vehicles, in spite of high gasoline prices and low fuel economy ratings, are in steady demand at car dealer lots; inventories are low, causing their values to stabilize or even increase; as car owners downsize, SUVs account for 4.5 percent of used-vehicle market, up from 4.2 percent in 2011.
lead_paragraph: A few years ago, rising gasoline prices pretty much destroyed the market for the big trucks, but they have become popular again.

headline.seo: Used Full-Size S.U.V.’s Are Making a Comeback
headline.main: As Car Owners Downsize, the Market Is Strong for Their Used S.U.V.’s
headline.print_headline: For Some, the Very Big Is Still a Lure

keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
keywords.name: subject
